## removePostFix() function

Removes a postfix from a string if it exists. If the postfix does not exist then the string is passed through unedited.

For example, when passed "foo" and post fix "\_bar", "foo" will be returned. If you pass "foo\_bar" and "\_bar" then "\_bar" will be removed and "foo" will be returned.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
export declare function removePostFix(original: string, postFix: string): string;
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  original | string |  |
|  postFix | string |  |

<b>Returns:</b>

string
